intro: Dombeya warneckei, commonly known as the velvetleaf dombeya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. The flowers are primarily pollinated by birds, especially sunbirds, and the plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds.
